articles.title: Protective genetic mutations may unlock new Alzheimer's treatments - PsyPost
articles.description: Recent findings show that certain genetic mutations can delay the onset of Alzheimer's symptoms, and understanding these protective genes could pave the way for treatments that not only slow the disease's progression but potentially prevent it altogether. ...
articles.content: Diseases that run in families usually have genetic causes. Some are genetic mutations that directly cause the disease if inherited. Others are risk genes that affect the body in a way that increases … [+7631 chars]

articles.title: Not getting enough sleep? Your vascular cells may be drowning in oxidants, says study - Medical Xpress
